newsitem.title: BAHRAIN: PRESS DIGEST - Saudi newspapers - April 29.
newsitem.headline: PRESS DIGEST - Saudi newspapers - April 29.

text.p: These are some of the leading stories in the Saudi Arabian press on Tuesday. Reuters has not verified these stories and does not vouch for their accuracy.
- Prince Sultan, second deputy premier and defence and aviation minister, stresses on the need for setting up a higher tourism commission to promote domestic tourism.
- Saudi Basic Industries Corporation (SABIC) posts 1.08 billion riyal net profit in the first three months of 1997.
- Jeddah police arrests a man suspected of stealing 2.8 million riyals from a Saudi bank.
- The kingdom spends 20 percent of its budget on the education sector.
- The number of Saudi-American projects is about 200 with a total investment of 12 billion riyals, U.S ambassador says.
